column4: How can I change the permissions on a single program to run with root privlages
What program is it?  Why does it need to run as root?
You could use setUID or just sudo
Make the owner root and turn on the setUID bit.  Does that make sense?
I'm not sure how to do that
to set the file as root:  sudo chown root /path/to/file

beli is advising we use sudo.  The difference is that if we use setUID any user will be allowed to run your program.  If we make people use sudo to run it only sudoers can run it.  It is your call.  Technically sudo is a more secure alternative
I want anyone to be able to run this program
I think it might need to be 4755   (allowing others to execute) it's kinda tricky with setUID on
see what beli said?  he is correct
